title: Charity & Caring for the Poor Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Charity & Caring for the Poor
description: Test your knowledge of the 13 biblical commandments related to charity & caring for the poor. Covers 7 positive and 6 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment instructs to leave a corner of the field uncut for the poor?
options: Leave a corner of the field uncut for the poor
Do not reap the corner of a field left for the poor
Separate the tithe for the poor
Give charity to those in need
questions.correctAnswer: Leave a corner of the field uncut for the poor
questions.explanation: This is commandment #239, a positive mitzvah found in Leviticus 19:10 instructing to leave part of the field for the poor.

questions.question: What is the polarity of the commandment 'Do not gather gleanings of a crop but leave them for the poor'?
options: Negative
Positive
Neutral
Conditional
questions.explanation: Commandment #242 is a negative commandment forbidding gathering gleanings that should be left for the poor, as stated in Leviticus 19:9.

questions.question: In which book and chapter is the commandment to 'Leave the forgotten sheaves in the field for the poor' found?
options: Deuteronomy 24
Leviticus 19
Deuteronomy 15
Leviticus 23
questions.explanation: Commandment #247 is found in Deuteronomy 24:19 and requires leaving forgotten sheaves for the poor.

questions.question: What does the positive commandment #250 require?
options: Give charity to those in need
Do not withhold charity from the poor
Separate the tithe for the poor
Leave the unformed clusters of grapes for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Give charity to those in need
questions.explanation: Commandment #250 commands to freely open one's hand and generously help those in need, as in Deuteronomy 15:8.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not reap the corner of a field left for the poor' appears in Leviticus 19:9.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Commandment #240 forbids reaping the corner of the field left for the poor, found in Leviticus 19:9.

questions.question: Which commandment is positive and instructs to separate the tithe for the poor every third year?
options: Separate the tithe for the poor
Give charity to those in need
Do not withhold charity from the poor
Do not gather the gleanings of a vineyard but leave them for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Separate the tithe for the poor
questions.explanation: Commandment #249 instructs to set aside the tithe for the poor every third year, as found in Deuteronomy 14:28.

questions.question: Which of the following is a negative commandment related to vineyards?
options: Do not pick the unformed clusters of grapes but leave them for the poor
Leave the gleanings of a vineyard for the poor
Separate the tithe for the poor
Give charity to those in need
questions.correctAnswer: Do not pick the unformed clusters of grapes but leave them for the poor
questions.explanation: Commandment #246 is a negative mitzvah forbidding picking unformed grape clusters, as in Leviticus 19:10.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #251 states that one may withhold charity from the poor if they choose.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Commandment #251 forbids withholding charity from the poor and commands compassion, as in Deuteronomy 15:7.

questions.question: What is the relationship between commandments #239 and #240?
options: One is positive to leave the corner of the field, the other is negative forbidding to reap it
Both are positive commandments about charity
Both forbid reaping the entire field
One commands charity, the other commands tithing
questions.correctAnswer: One is positive to leave the corner of the field, the other is negative forbidding to reap it
questions.explanation: Commandments #239 (positive) and #240 (negative) complement each other regarding the corner of the field for the poor (Leviticus 19:9-10).

questions.question: According to the commandments, what must be done with the gleanings of a crop during harvest?
options: Leave the gleanings for the poor
Gather all gleanings for personal use
Burn the gleanings
Sell the gleanings to the needy
questions.correctAnswer: Leave the gleanings for the poor
questions.explanation: Commandments #241 (positive) and #242 (negative) instruct leaving the gleanings of the crop for the poor (Leviticus 19:9).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'When you reap your harvest and have forgotten a sheaf in the field, you shall not go back to get it; it shall be for the _______, for the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.'
options: alien
landowner
priest
merchant
questions.explanation: This is from commandment #247, instructing to leave forgotten sheaves for the alien (foreigner), found in Deuteronomy 24:19.

questions.question: True or False: Leaving the unformed clusters of grapes for the poor is a negative commandment.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Commandment #245 is positive, commanding leaving unformed grape clusters for the poor (Leviticus 19:10).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids picking the fallen fruit of your vineyard because it should be left for the needy and stranger?
options: Do not gather the gleanings of a vineyard but leave them for the poor
Leave the unformed clusters of grapes for the poor
Separate the tithe for the poor
Give charity to those in need
questions.correctAnswer: Do not gather the gleanings of a vineyard but leave them for the poor
questions.explanation: Commandment #244 forbids gathering fallen fruit from vineyards, leaving it for the needy as in Leviticus 19:10.

questions.question: What practical action does the positive commandment #249 require every third year?
options: Bring out all the tithe of your produce and deposit it in your town for the poor
Reap the entire harvest including corners
Pick all the unformed grape clusters
Gather all forgotten sheaves from the field
questions.correctAnswer: Bring out all the tithe of your produce and deposit it in your town for the poor
questions.explanation: Commandment #249 requires setting aside the tithe for the poor every third year as per Deuteronomy 14:28.

questions.question: Which of these commandments is NOT part of the 'Providing for the Poor' category?
options: Do not steal
Leave gleanings of a field for the poor
Give charity to those in need
Separate the tithe for the poor
questions.explanation: 'Do not steal' is not listed among the 13 commandments in the 'Providing for the Poor' category.
